attributes.action: The Government to take the UK out of the ECJ & end free movement in March 2019
attributes.background: The government have been given a mandate by the people of the UK. If we have not left the jurisdiction of the ECJ after March 2019 then we have not left the EU. We also mandated you to stop free movement. If not enforced correctly, this would be a denial of the peoples democratic vote.

attributes.action: Allow Premier League and Championship football clubs to introduce safe standing
attributes.background: Safe Standing offers a much safer alternative to fans who wish to stand, rather than sit at football matches. After the highly successful introduction to rail seating at Celtic Park, as well as numerous Bundesliga clubs, many football fans feel that laws preventing standing areas should be relaxed.
attributes.additional_details:
Some football clubs that already have successfully installed rail seating are: Celtic, Werder Bremen, Hamburg SV, Vfl Wolfsburg, Hannover 96 and the famous “yellow wall” at Borussia Dortmund. 

In conclusion, there is a clear demand for safe standing with 92% of respondents saying fans should be given the choice to stand in safe standing areas, in a poll by the Football Fans Census, and it would only promote English football further by improving the overall matchday experience.

attributes.action: Abolish prescription charges
attributes.background: England is the only part of the UK who still charges prescription charges. Prescription charges make medications unaffordable. The Prescription Charges Coalition found that 1 in 3 people with a long term condition who paid for their medications did not pick up their medication due to costs.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.prescriptionchargescoalition.org.uk/uploads/1/2/7/5/12754304/still_paying_the_price_june_2017.pdf

attributes.action: Make removing items from a grave without permission illegal
attributes.background: We are creating this petition on behalf of all grieving parents and families who would like to decorate their child's grave, without the risk that cemetery staff may remove items without getting  permission from the family.
attributes.additional_details: We lost our baby girl Niamh at 22 weeks and 4 days and wanted to lay her to rest in a place where she wouldn't be disturbed by cemetery staff removing her belongings for health and safety reasons, in case the lawnmower ran the stones over and caused an interference or, in the words of the cemetery manager, "caused a death".

attributes.action: Give mothers and fathers 50/50 custody of children in separation or divorce.
attributes.background: Fathers are just as important to the health development of children. Often limiting a father's access affects a child more than is realised creating societal and mental health issues for the child later in life. Don't make children decide between parents but have a balanced upbringing.
attributes.additional_details: Currently men generally only receive every other weekend in the courts and many use their children as a weapon to hurt fathers, when in fact children are being hurt. Men are considered second class citizens with mothers stating fathers must "win their children over" when mums have to make no effort. Children are used to inflict pain on another part and its not fair on the child to be in this position and having to take sides. I propose to give equal access and go to court for more as in the USA.

attributes.action: Make all supermarkets sell a full comprehensive range of vegan foods and drinks.
attributes.background: More people would go vegan if shopping was easier. This would help our planet and spare the torture of the animals. Make it law for major supermarkets to stock a full range of food and drink alternatives.

attributes.action: Theresa May to publicly condemn the government of Myanmar/Burma
attributes.background: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres said the Rohingyas were facing a catastrophic humanitarian situation, and attacks on villagers were unacceptable. The UN Security Council has called for urgent steps to end the violence.
attributes.additional_details: Amnesty said it had new evidence based on satellite imagery, photos and videos, as well as interviews with eye-witnesses, of "an orchestrated campaign of systematic burnings" targeting Rohingya villages for almost three weeks. "The evidence is irrefutable - the Myanmar security forces are setting northern Rakhine State ablaze in a targeted campaign to push the Rohingya people out of Myanmar. Make no mistake: this is ethnic cleansing," said Tirana Hassan, the group's crisis response director.

attributes.action: Ensure direct train services are maintained/improved to London from Surrey Heath
attributes.background: In recent times a direct train to London Waterloo, servicing residents from Surrey Heath (Frimley, Camberley and Bagshot) was introduced. This allowed commuters three direct trains in the morning and two returns in the evening. This is now under threat from new train franchise operator SWR.
attributes.additional_details:
SWR took over the franchise in Aug 2017. The previous operator SWT invested in extended platforms, to accommodate this service.

This is due to be removed in 2018.

Please support this pertition to prevent this vital service being removed.

attributes.action: Enact New UK Legislation to Ban Food Waste
attributes.background: No country in Europe wastes as much food as the UK, despite millions of children, homeless and vulnerable people sleeping hungry at night. In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. We urge the UK government to enact a similar law.
attributes.additional_details: The £17 billion of food thrown away in the UK (WRAP). In the last 5 years, homelessness has also doubled and three million school children also risk hunger. Inspiringly, France has passed a law to ban food waste with fines and imprisonment for defaulters. In the UK, too, nutritious rescued food can feed the homeless and children in schools. The Government must uphold the right to food for every citizen and urgently pass a strong law to tackle food poverty and food waste.

attributes.action: Introduce a 20% cap on national media ownership.
attributes.background:
TalkPolitics is calling for an end to monopolies on media ownership. Over 50% of national UK papers sold, are controlled by two billionaires. 

We're calling for stricter regulations, that limit the amount of national media that can be owned by one person/company to 20%.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to;

- Make the Media Market truly free and competitive,
- Create a defence against abuse of market power,
- Ensure a free press rather than one controlled by media moguls,
- Protect against corporate greed in a market essential to democracy.

For more information about how this policy could work, read our in-depth policy analysis here: https://talk-politics.com/policy-analysis-20-cap-on-national-media-ownership/

attributes.action: Lower the cervical smear test age to 18!
attributes.background: We want to lower the age of smear tests from 25 to 18. If we cannot lower it to 18 we should at least let girls from 18 be allowed to get a test if they so wish!
attributes.additional_details: Every 2 in 100 girls that are diagnosed are under the age of 25. If there is history in the family of cervical cancer I believe girls should be allowed to be tested and not have to wait until they are 25! Please see sense! Sign this petition so that we may help others and potentially our children or our children's children in the future!

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear service medals that you have not been awarded.
attributes.background: I am a Veteran of the Northern Ireland troubles and the Falklands War 1982. In both conflicts I lost friends. They did not see the medals that they had earned. It annoys me to see anybody wearing medals that they have not earned. I find it disrespectful to my friends and all the others who gave all.
attributes.additional_details: We are asked to sign a blank cheque, up to the value of our life. For this we may get a medal. To see somebody walking around wearing medals, who didn't serve or sign on, is disgusting. They have never put their life on the line. They have never been on active service and faced the enemy. Why should they be allowed to bring contempt upon the uniform of somebody who has come forward and protected the people of this country?

attributes.action: Introduce a 10p disposable cup tax in the UK
attributes.background: Based on the success of the single use plastic bag tax of October 2015, a single use cup tax would help encourage more people to switch to reusable coffee cups, further reducing the UK's plastic waste output.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove, Twitter, 6:37pm 20/11/17:
"Still haunted by last night's #BluePlanet2 - the imperative to do more to tackle plastic in our oceans is clear. We @DefraGovUK will work urgently to identify further action."

Many coffee shops like Costa and Starbucks offer customers the option to provide their own cup, usually encouraged by a small discount. This incentive, combined with the extra cost of a cup tax, should encourage many people to make a small sustainable change.

attributes.action: Introduce a carbon tax on applicable products to help battle climate change.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on products that are increasing the levels of carbon dioxide in the earths atmosphere. Offset the tax by reducing others on products/services that are better for the environment making it financially beneficial for people to make the right decisions on what they buy.
attributes.additional_details: This kind of tax would be similar to car tax in the way that an engine with lower emission levels is cheaper than one that has a higher level, and cars such as those powered by electricity have zero tax. This would make healthier foods more attainable to people and junk food more expensive, thus improving the publics health reducing the strain on services like the NHS. Another example, electricity provided by companies using renewable technologies would be cheaper than those using fossil fuels.

attributes.action: Allow and run a referendum in Wales to decide the future of the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Over the past 20 years the many in Wales have become dissatisfied by the unnecessary bureaucracy known as the Welsh Assembly (WA).  Due to its ineffective and costly intervention at all levels of Welsh life it's time to have another referendum to allow us to decide if the WA should continue or not.
attributes.additional_details: There are many reasons why the Welsh Assembly (WA) should be dissolved.  These include excessive running costs each year.  A growing North/South Wales divide in terms of investment.  Anything that the WA does could be done by Welsh MPs in government.  The WA has gone against the wishes of Wales on leaving the EU. It appears to be nothing but a talking shop for already failed ideas and now wants to take on the role of government imposing laws and taxes that would further divide us from the UK.

attributes.action: Lower the age restriction on smear tests to allow women under 25 to be eligible.
attributes.background:
- Sexual activity is legal from the age of 16, therefore so should smear tests
- Some women go for their first smear test at 25 & are having some sort of minor procedure which could have been resolved years prior. 
- Our health doesn’t have a start date for complications, it can happen at any age!
attributes.additional_details:
Below is reference of a case where a woman wasn’t taken seriously on her symptoms.

If your old enough to engage in sexual activity; your old enough to be taken seriously with any health symptoms & concerns you may have. 

The cervical cancer injection is powerless on its own, however with the age of the smear tests being lowered I think it would be effective. 

http://metro.co.uk/2015/07/24/this-21-year-old-mum-has-just-two-years-to-live-after-being-denied-a-smear-test-5310462/

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for councils to provide essential public toilets.
attributes.background: Throughout the country council are closing public toilets in cost cutting measures but these decision are unfair on certain sections of our society, especially young and disabled persons. It is a natural requirement for us all to use the toilets and facilities should be made available where needed.
attributes.additional_details: At public open spaces where public toilets have been removed this has discriminated against those who are now unable to benefit from the health and well being these open spaces provide because of their need to use the a toilet. Discriminating against any section of society is unlawful in both UK and EU law but this has not deterred councils for closing public toilets. If legislation were created then they would no longer be able to use the excuse, "We have no legal requirement to provide them"

attributes.action: Reduce the risk of flooding by halting major developments on our floodplains
attributes.background: We ask the government to act responsibly regarding safety to new and existing communities and show more environmental foresight. We ask for legislation to be passed that forbids strategic development  allocations from being situated within all flood zones or areas that impact upon them.
attributes.additional_details:
With the ever increasing impact of climate change, it is becoming more important than ever to avoid man-made disasters. Once the floodplain is developed, there is no turning back."
 The 2007 Pitt report said "wherever possible, new development should not take place in flood risk areas and that there should be a strong presumption against building on the floodplain.” This is currently not always adhered to where non flood plain options could be made available hence the requirement for legislation

attributes.action: UK Government Please Help Igbo ethnic group Nigeria.
attributes.background: The Arewa Youth Consultative Forum in Northern Nigeria on 6/06/2017 gave ultimatum telling the Igbos living in the northern Nigeria to vacate their homes.There are hate songs/messages urging northerners to destroy the properties of Igbos and kill anyone who refuses to leave by 01/10/2017.
attributes.additional_details: A recent United Nations Human Rights expert news release (25th August 2017) denounced the ultimatum and threat targeting the Igbos. There is military presence in the Igbo homeland of south eastern Nigeria.There is currently tension and fear among Igbos in the northern and eastern regions of Nigeria.UK government please urge the Nigerian government to dialogue and call off the ongoing military presence in South Eastern Nigeria to avoid tension that could degenerate into full scale civil war.

attributes.action: Light beacons across the country on March 29th 2019 to celebrate Brexit
attributes.background:
At 11pm on March 29th 2019 our country will leave the EU.
To celebrate this historic and momentous occasion, we believe the Government should arrange for beacons to be lit from Lands End to John O'Groats and at all points in between.
attributes.additional_details:
After over 40 years of Brussels rule, we are finally leaving the EU.
Lighting beacons around the country would be a symbolic gesture celebrating our independence and sovereignty.

attributes.action: Create a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy
attributes.background: The Bishop's review of Hillsborough families' experiences recommends the creation of a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy. The Government must implement this recommendation. This petition was started by bereaved relatives of family members who perished in the Grenfell Tower fire.
attributes.additional_details: The Charter will include commitments by public bodies to change in relation to transparency and acting in the public interest. By adopting this, the Government will show that it has learned the lessons of the Hillsborough disaster and ensure that the perspective of bereaved families is never lost. We’re concerned that the Grenfell public inquiry isn’t taking into account the views of bereaved families, survivors, and local community affected. They can be spared the indignities, pain and suffering Bishop James Jones describes in his report as "The Patronising disposition of unaccountable power".

attributes.action: Help Assist in Rejuvenating the Sacred Holy Yamuna River
attributes.background: Yamuna River (India), is worshipped by millions of devotees all around the world through pious banks of Vrindavan, Mathura and Gokul. The river has many spiritual significance to all. This very river is polluted with toxic industrial and domestic waste from Delhi and other drains.
attributes.additional_details: United Nation has declared the Yamuna River dead. There is no fresh flow, flowing through whole stretch. Devotees are forced to take a sip, bath and perform religious activities in these toxic polluted waters. We urge the UK Government to assist the Indian Government to treat their Industrial and Domestic waste and not to pour treated or untreated waste water into Yamuna River. Furthermore ensure adequate natural flow of fresh water throughout the stretch,which starts from Yamunotri to Allahabad

attributes.action: we ask for financial assistance for replacements or replacements done on NHS
attributes.background: PIP illegally manufacted and sold breast implants in the U.K. made from industrial-grade silicone, these implants were found to have a 500% higher risk of rupturing or leaking. also implicated in several deaths due to systemic toxicity and several cases of induced breast cancer. woman need your help
attributes.additional_details:
The director of the company has been sent to prison. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2012/jan/06/pip-breast-implant-removed-free

Removal was offered but woman need removal and replacement as otherwise will be left with sagging skin and had paid money for quality products but were lied to and these were passed by government regulations. 

https://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/PIP-implants/Pages/Introduction.aspx

private companies that women went to have been unwilling to help or went into liquidation

attributes.action: Introduce Black History to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background:
To make Black History part of the school curriculum for Primary education such as It helps to enrich the development of the spiritual, moral, social and cultural needs of all ethnic groups.

We believe Black History should be made a mandatory element of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Make the PassivHaus standard mandatory for new buildings in the UK
attributes.background: The PassivHaus standard delivers buildings that are healthy, comfortable, and cheap to heat, with heating bills and resulting carbon emissions less than 10% of the average UK building stock. Fuel poverty and climate change can be delivered through high levels of internal comfort.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite the obvious benefits of the standard, the construction industry often requires more stick than carrot, with full take-up of the standard only happening in places where legislation has been brought about, such as Brussels, Frankfurt and Dún Laoghaire.

While the Building Regs are based on the minimum acceptable standard the building industry will deliver buildings of low performance, with high energy wastage, poor comfort conditions and contradicting design and living practices.

attributes.action: Explain why the 2016 EU referendum was called with only four months' notice
attributes.background: The decision on staying in or leaving the EU is a major constitutional issue and could have far-reaching consequences. We believe that four months (February to June 2016) was not long enough for voters to consider carefully all the issues involved before making a properly informed decision.
attributes.additional_details: Since the vote, many issues regarding the consequences of Brexit have emerged that were hardly discussed during the referendum campaign. The date of the 2014 Scottish independence referendum was announced two years in advance, as this was deemed to be a major constitutional matter which would require this length of time for voters to make their decision. We believe that the date of the EU referendum should have been announced at least a year in advance.

attributes.action: Change marriage law in England/Wales from registered buildings to celebrants.
attributes.background: The Scots system of registered celebrants is very much simpler than the English and Welsh system of registered buildings, and it also affords greater flexibility to couples.
attributes.additional_details: Currently in England and Wales couples must choose either a religious service in a church, or a wholly secular service in secular building, where they are not allowed anything even vaguely religious including music. Under the Scots system couples can choose any venue in which a celebrant is willing to conduct a marriage service, and a religious or civil ceremony. This means that couples can choose a religious ceremony in a greater choice of venues, and administration is simpler (and probably cheaper).

attributes.action: Pay teachers for the the time they spend on placements in schools
attributes.background: Trainee teachers are required to spend significant time working in  schools without pay. They are relied on as full members of staff and should be entitled to at least minimum wage. Due to this commitment, they are unable to hold another job and often live on a loan of around £4,000 per year.
attributes.additional_details: The government offers bursaries for secondary school positions for those in certain areas or with certain qualifications. Working full time in a school severely limits the trainees to gain a secondary job to provide supplementary income. Primary trainees are eligible for student finance, which provides a very limited income and has to be repaid. Their service to a career path so important for our next generations deserves at least minimum wage. Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Outlaw and enforce the sale of V5 and V5C vehicle registration documents.
attributes.background:
The V5C registration document is the property of the DVLA and by law needs to be surrendered when a vehicle is disposed of. 
Sadly there is a black market of traders selling V5's and V5C's with or without VIN plates facilitating the change of a vehicle identity. Ringing kits for stolen vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
By selling a vehicle identity knowingly or not (remember ignorance is no defense) they could well be aiding and abetting the theft of a motor vehicle and should face the same penalties as anyone who is an associate before or after the fact. 

Banning the sale of V5, V5C, VIN plates and other documentation; and enforcing the existing laws more diligently it would effectively cut off the tide of illegal vehicle identity sales thus helping reduce the number of vehicle thefts in the UK.

attributes.action: Use a different coloured disabled badge for people with invisible disabilities.
attributes.background: Have you ever been a victim of verbal or physical abuse whilst using your blue badge? and do you have a condition that is not visible on the outside? I think there should be another way for us to show others that there are people with disabilities that can’t be seen.

attributes.action: Death penalty for those found guilty of plotting or committing acts of terror
attributes.background:
Society is built entirely on trust. Trust between shop keeper and customer; trust between driver and passenger; trust between worker and employer.
Humanity has, over thousands of years, developed this system of trust so that we may live in peace, together.
There are few, seeking to destroy it.

attributes.action: UK must apologise for Balfour Declaration and commit to Mideast peace efforts
attributes.background: We call on Her Majesty's government, led by Prime Minister Theresa May, to officially apologise to the Palestinian people for issuing the Balfour Declaration in 1917
attributes.additional_details: Balfour, a public statement issued by the British government during World War I announcing support for the establishment of a Jewish state in Palestine, has led to mass displacement of the Palestinian nation. November 7 2017 will mark 100 years since Balfour. https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/8e/Balfour_declaration_unmarked.jpg

attributes.action: Stop Southern Rail being able to increase their fares in January
attributes.background: Southern Rail have a long and well documented history of terrible service. We believe this will continue irrespective of financial investment. Given the last two years of hell commuters have endured because of their dependence on Southern, they should not be allowed to increase their fares.
attributes.additional_details: There is a myriad of websites, forums and social media pertaining to the disruption Southern have caused for commuters over the last two years. People have had to move house for work. People have lost jobs. Even now in London, companies are screening candidates based on their dependence on Southern rail. These are facts and in no other arena can a company provide such abysmal service and continue to raise prices.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable packaging materials by 31st December 2020.
attributes.background:
It's crazy that we are still buying products with mixed packaging materials where part of it is recyclable and part of it not. 
I believe this means we recycle significantly less than we could as some people do not bother to sort it and just throw everything into the general rubbish.
attributes.additional_details: The need to reduce the use of landfill and to increase recycling is widely accepted and I believe this would be a major step forward to making a greener more sustainable future for our country and the world

attributes.action: Increase security at unmanned train stations to prevent suicide
attributes.background: All unmanned train stations should have security gates and CCTV that captures motion. No passengers should be allowed onto the platform until the train has stopped. People getting off trains should be monitored to make sure they leave the station. This would help to prevent suicide and accidents.
attributes.additional_details: My son Oscar Phillips took his own life aged just 16, with no history or signs of any mental illness. Oscar one day took himself to our local station and never came back. A lonely unmanned station, with 80mph trains passing, but no restrictions on public access.

attributes.action: Stop Botox & Dermal fillers on minors by making it illegal for those under 18
attributes.background: Cosmetic doctors, nurses, dentists and surgeons have been calling for tougher regulations for injectables. In the UK, it’s almost entirely unregulated with no minimum age for those seeking out Botox or dermal fillers.
attributes.additional_details: Without enforcement of any laws there has been an increase in botched treatments, some of which have been very dangerous, leaving the vulnerable millennial generation at most risk.

attributes.action: Publish a breakdown of any Brexit money agreed after negotiations are complete
attributes.background: It would seem reasonable that if we are to pay any figure to the EU on Brexit that the British public should know specifically what we are paying this money for in the form of a detailed breakdown. Particularly since the legal basis for paying any money is in doubt.
attributes.additional_details:
https://youtu.be/2Xu-hI9Ci4U

http://johnredwoodsdiary.com/2017/01/29/there-is-no-legal-basis-for-making-any-extra-payments-to-the-eu/

attributes.action: All high-rise tower blocks over 30 metres must have sprinklers installed.
attributes.background: Sprinklers save the lives of tower block residents and firefighters. Lives could have been saved in the fatal fires at Grenfell Tower and Lakanal House in London, and at Shirley Towers in Southampton. The new law should include a duty on local authorities and the local fire service to enforce.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2013, the Coroner of the Shirley Towers fire recommended that:
"Social housing providers should be encouraged to consider the retrofitting of sprinklers in all existing high-rise buildings in excess of 30 metres in height." Fire experts recommend sprinklers too. Yet in all this time, seven years after Shirley Towers, councils and housing providers have failed to install sprinklers. We should not wait for the Grenfell Tower investigations to complete. The law must change NOW.

attributes.action: Make Sanitary Wear free on prescription for girls under 16 and women on benefits
attributes.background:
sanitary wear should be made freely available to those entitled to free prescriptions, namely women on low incomes, girls under the age of 16 and homeless women
women will use on average 11,000 items in her lifetime, for those who suffer with gynaecological conditions this will be higher.
attributes.additional_details: Along with the health risks associated with not having appropriate menstrual support, it is now more frequently affecting women at work and the education of girls as many will remain at home due to the inability to purchase the necessary items.– many of these staff are on low incomes themselves – this in itself can cause financial difficulties. It is also impacting on staff in schools as they are often purchasing these items to ensure that girls do not take time out of the classroom.
attributes.creator_name: Sarah James - GMB Union BOSS group

attributes.action: Change what DWP are allowed to take off your Benefits from 40% to maximum 20%
attributes.background: At the moment for a single adult claimant of Universal Credit the law states we can live on £317.82 but can take 40% (£127) of this to pay off likes of budget loans or rent arrears etc leaving someone with very little to live on after bills & food
attributes.additional_details:
£317.82 is for a single person over 25yr old as stated here: https://www.gov.uk/universal-credit/what-youll-get

Now for someone only on Universal Credit that £127 a month reduction can cause serious hardship. Please help us to get this amount reduced to a more manageable amount such as £31 (10%) or £63 (20) at the most.

Universal Credit as many of you are aware is the new blanket benefit for anyone whether unemployed part time worker or disabled.

attributes.action: To reform outdated English marriage law, which is no longer ‘Fit For Purpose’
attributes.background:
We need to reform the Marriage Act 1949 as it is 70 years out of date. 

Make it compulsory for every faith to register marriages, not just 3 faiths (Anglicans, Jews and Quakers). 

100,000s have no legal rights in an unregistered religious marriage and this figure is rising yearly.
attributes.additional_details:
Religious marriages conducted abroad are legally recognised, but UK religious marriages are not. The result? Chaos, injustice and discrimination:

- Overnight homelessness, destitution
- lost savings invested in ‘matrimonial’ home 
- No Pension or Inheritance rights
- Men, women and children suffer

There are no Cohabitation rights - and these couples face a double handicap as they thought they were married.

In the 21st century, a fair and equal marriage law needs to cover all faiths.

attributes.action: Oblige employers to give paid leave for parents of kids with chronic illnesses.
attributes.background: Parents of children with chronic illnesses (e.g. juvenile idiopathic arthritis or juvenile diabetes) need time off work for frequent medical appointments, meaning parents often lose their jobs or cannot continue to work, leading to hardship.  The law should provide for permitted, paid time off.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that all new building developments incorporate solar panels
attributes.background: There is a requirement for alternative energy, and given the number of new houses required moving forward, this would be an ideal strategy to help alleviate the use of fossil and nuclear energy.
attributes.additional_details: It would also be easier to connect to the national grid at the build stage rather than having to retro-fit at a later stage. it would also help increase the solar power industry.

attributes.action: Regulate the eyelash extension industry making training compulsory
attributes.background: Let’s make our lash industry safe, by regulating it we avoid non trained individuals to practice without a license. This would minimise the risks of lash and eye damage

attributes.action: Stop the setting of homework for children until the age of 14 in the UK.
attributes.background:
Homework is killing our children’s love of learning.

We need to remove the unnecessary pressure and stress of homework.  We need to liberate our children to enjoy the fun and freedom in life.
attributes.additional_details: I do believe that work beyond the classroom becomes relevant and important as children embark on their GCSE and A Levels.  I also believe that there is an argument for determined practice but this needs to be driven from within and a desire to learn and succeed; not a product of relentless persuasion from a parent.   Unfortunately, by the time children reach GCSE, homework has become an arduous task with little meaning or benefit.  It is purely a task which has to be endured; there is no investment or passion.

attributes.action: Teach pupils to check themselves as part of sex education to prevent cancer
attributes.background: At 29 years old, Simone Ferman, mother of two from Essex was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer. The lump was discovered by her partner - Simone never checked herself as she didn't know how to. If pupils were taught this as part of sex education in schools, it could save thousands of lives.
attributes.additional_details: If you have a sore throat, you go to the doctor and get medicine. If you find a lump, you go and get it checked - Yes? Wrong! Most people don't get it checked as they don't know they have a lump and then it's too late. There are millions of men and women who don't check themselves as they don't know how. We need to raise awareness as if a lump is cancerous and caught early, there is a very high survival rate. Pupils therefore need to be taught in school, as part of sex education, how to check.

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave compulsory and paid
attributes.background: Make compassionate leave for close family members (parents, children, siblings, partners, in-laws and grandparents) compulsory for companies to recognize, and for the leave to be paid so the surviving family member is not left shortpaid due to the relatives death.
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2017, both of my grandfathers passed away. My company did not grant compassionate leave either time, giving me the only option to take it as unpaid sick leave. This pushed me into financial difficulty which I have yet to come out of, playing catch up each month. 

My cousin had the same situation, having to take annual leave on the day of our grandfathers death.

Family members dying is hard enough to deal with emotionally, the worker should not be affected financially as well.

attributes.action: Fairer road fund licence rates for motorcycles.
attributes.background: HMRC allows 24p per mile for business use on motorcycles yet allows 45p per mile for cars, it therefore seems unfair that motorcycles can pay considerably more in road fund licence than cars with similar emissions, they should be encouraged to be part of an integrated traffic solution not penalised.
attributes.additional_details: Motorcycles take up less space on our overcrowded roads, don't usually get held up in traffic and take up far less space when parked, as a result they will usually pollute less than most cars, yet motorcycles pay road fund licences based purely on engine size.  This means that modern, low emission machines can be paying £85 per year compared to zero for similarly poluting cars.  We therefore call on the government to reduce the road fund licences on all motorcycles.

attributes.action: Outlaw the inhumane slaughter of fish in commercial and non-commercial fishing
attributes.background: Fish are by far the UK's greatest victims of animal abuse as 800,000 suffer the following fates every day. Common methods of fish slaughter are cutting/filleting alive (fish remain conscious for 25-65 more mins) and suffocation (takes 55-250 minutes of complete agony). There are humane alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
Most reputable marine biologists, at major centers (including experts at the University of Cambridge and multiple national centres of marine life studies), now believe that fish can feel pain in as many ways that we do and that they are MUCH smarter than we previously thought. With that in mind, both non-commercial and commercial fisherman almost always use inhumane, prolonged methods of slaughter. 
Sources:  humane slaughter by fish count.org.uk.  Do Fish Feel Pain? by Jonathan Balcombe/PBS.
